other_tests.findings: Histopathological examination revealed findings consistent with acute folliculitis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Persistent rash with a waxing and waning pattern during the next 8 months despite treatment.

other_tests.findings: Histopathological examination revealed acute neutrophilic folliculitis, with follicular rupture in the middle dermis and associated acute and chronic inflammation.

other_tests.procedure_name: Fine-needle aspiration and core biopsy (right axillary lymph node)
other_tests.findings: Benign-appearing lymph-node tissue with normal architecture and associated necroinflammatory debris; no histologic evidence of cancer.
Histopathological examination showed a superficial and deep necrotizing granulomatous inflammatory infiltrate.
